item.title: What Happens If You Lose Cargo/Backpack in Death Stranding 2?
item.description:
While exploring the world of Death Stranding 2: On the Beach , players will encounter environmental hazards and BTs along their path that can delay cargo deliveries. However, these aren’t the only challenges one might face. There’s always a chance that the player may become careless or fall into a river, resulting in the loss of both cargo and backpack.

Even though this might sound disastrous, there are a few ways to recover the lost cargo, and the guide below provides all the information you need in Death Stranding 2 .

What Happens If You Lose Cargo/Backpack in Death Stranding 2?

In the case that you lost your cargo as well as your backpack to a strong river current or something else, do not worry, as the cargo will keep on pulsating, showing the location . This allows you to track down the cargo and grab it back. However, if you are unable to get your cargo back, you can simply head back to the centre or storage location where you got the cargo from. Firstly, select the Delivery Terminal option, and you can find the option here to fabricate your backpack . This will require materials, and you don't have to worry about losing your customizations, as you can restore them.

For the cargo, you must press "Start" on your controller and press the left D-pad to enter the Ring Terminal . Select the Orders option, and here you can see which order you are currently on and the option to redeploy the cargo . Doing so will transfer the cargo to the Private Locker of the facility where you accepted the order.

How to Get Stolen Cargo Back in Death Stranding 2

While trying to fight bandits inside an enemy camp, there is a possibility that you might get knocked out. In this situation, any cargo that Sam has will be stolen by the bandits, and you will be transported to a garbage dump . All the weapons you were carrying will also be taken, so if you plan on getting your stuff back, you’ll need to rely on stealth knockdowns. To locate the stolen cargo, open your map or use L1 to analyze the enemy camp and find a MULE Postbox .

The MULE Postbox can be hacked , and upon doing so, you’ll find all your goods inside, ready for the taking. However, be cautious, as hacking the postbox can leave you vulnerable.

Make sure you’ve cleared out the surrounding area before going in for the hack.

item.title: Palia NPC Romance Tier List
item.description:
Palia ’s charm lies not just in its gorgeous landscapes or cozy gameplay, but in the relationships players form along the way. From foraging with friends to decorating dream homes, Palia fosters a sense of community that naturally leads to deeper bonds. But as with any cozy life sim, not all love interests are created equal. Some NPCs deliver compelling character growth and emotional payoff, while others leave players wanting more.

For players seeking a little love in their day-to-day routines, Palia offers eleven romanceable NPCs, each with their own personalities, routines, and stories to discover. Whether someone’s looking for a slow burn, a flirty best friend, or a mysterious stranger, this list breaks down which Palia romances are worth the investment and which still need a little narrative polish in future game updates.

S-Tier: That Disney-Standard Kind of Love

Jina

Jina’s sweet curiosity and deep intellect make her one of Palia ’s most rewarding romances. Her love of ancient artifacts and scholarly pursuits brings depth, and her interactions with the player are consistently thoughtful. Every new milestone feels earned, and her dialogue delivers a warm sincerity that’s easy to fall for. In fact, Jina is an excellent choice for people who romanced Penny in Stardew Valley .

Tish

The furniture queen of Kilima brings more than just gorgeous interiors to the table. Tish’s romance is bubbly and heartfelt, with genuine emotional stakes beneath her cheerful demeanor. She's a natural nurturer, and the player’s growing bond with her feels authentic as a result.

Nai’o

Nai’o is the responsible older brother trope done right. Dependable, hardworking, and kind, his story arc reads straight from a Hallmark classic, yet striking a great balance between quiet strength and gentle vulnerability. His romance path is one of Palia ’s best because it unfolds with care, and the emotional payoff is strong, as he’s the kind of character who’s worth committing to. To top it all off, his romance starts with a little bit of spice, since there is another villager on his mind when the romance quest launches.

A-Tier: Solid Partners With Room to Grow

Hassian

The brooding ranger with a soft spot for animals and solitude is a classic romance archetype, and Palia executes it well. Hassian’s relationship with his dog Tau is adorable, and his gradual warming to the player beyond Palia ’s hunting tutorial obligations is satisfying. By the end of the romance quest, Hassian the hunter is a true romantic, making him ideal for players who want that gushy kind of feeling from their in-game romances. Still, his dialogue can sometimes feel sparse, keeping him just shy of S-tier.

Kenyatta

Kenyatta brings big “rebel with a heart” energy, just like Abigail from Stardew Valley . Her youthful fire and strained relationship with her mayoral mother add dimension to her personality, and her secret romance with Nai’o offers juicy side drama for a player to decode. She’s fun and layered, though some of her romantic moments feel like they need just a bit more polish—perhaps due to her rugged nature, but still, more moments where she lets her guard down would be nice to see.

Reth

Reth is charming, confident, and always ready with a joke or a meal. His flirty banter keeps the early stages of his romance path entertaining, and his backstory adds more weight than expected. A way to a player’s heart is through their stomach, and Reth embodies that literally by teaching the player how to cook in Palia . That said, his emotional beats don’t land as hard as some others, keeping him comfortably in A-tier.

B-Tier: Likeable, But Missing a Spark

Hodari

Hodari is a solid character who feels grounded in his mining work and family life. His romantic arc leans more toward a “slow burn,” but sometimes feels too slow due to the complexity of progressing his romance. While he’s a likable presence in Kilima, and his maturity makes him an incredible option for some players, his romance just doesn’t shine as brightly compared to others since the player always feels secondary to his child.

Jel

As the fashion-forward tailor of Kilima, Jel’s vibe is all flair and drama, which can be a lot of fun for players who are used to characters like Eliott from Stardew Valley or Astarion from Baldur’s Gate 3 . However, his romantic path doesn’t offer much growth or emotional depth yet. He feels more like a flirty friend with a few poetic lines, but he surely has the potential of being one of Palia ’s best romances if Singularity 6 expands on his story.

Subira

Subira is poised and professional, and her elegant persona is easy to admire. Her guarded nature adds intrigue, but that same distance keeps her romance from feeling particularly personal. While there’s potential here, her romance currently lacks the emotional momentum of higher-tier contenders. However, for certain players who long for the Mr. Darcy-type of restraint or a forbidden romance trope, Subira may be in the S-Tier on their personal lists.

C-Tier: The Ones That Need More Love (Literally)

Einar

For anyone who had dreamed of romancing Legion from Mass Effect , Einar is here to answer the call. Einar is a gentle ancient being with a deep reverence for the world around him and a pebble collection that rivals anyone’s. While his uniqueness is appreciated, and his love for fishing is adorable, his romance arc lacks the intimacy and engagement players may be seeking. More depth could lift him, but for now, he remains more novelty than heartthrob.

Tamala

Tamala is mysterious and magical, but her aloofness keeps many players at arm’s length. Her romance feels like it could bloom into something hauntingly beautiful, yet never quite crosses the threshold due to her personality. A more involved arc would give this enigmatic herbalist the emotional grounding she needs to climb the ranks, but currently, she lacks the development to make her romance something worth chasing. The negative reactions from other Palians when pursing her doesn't help matters.

DIGITAL

Explore a vibrant new world made just for you with Palia, a free-to-play, cozy sim MMO game. Craft, cook, fish, and farm with friends as you live the life of your dreams and discover an enchanting adventure filled with colorful characters and a mystery to unravel.

Do What You Love: Fish and farm or cook and catch insects - you can live off the land any way you like! Tend to your home plot and nurture your garden or explore Kilima Valley and Bahari Bay to forage for items, ingredients, and rare critters.

An Always-Evolving Adventure: Unravel a deep mystery about what happened to ancient humans as you reappear in a world alongside other players.

Befriend the local Majiri, learn their backstories, foster relationships, and maybe even romance! Be sure to give back to the community by providing gifts and honing your skills in fishing, hunting, crafting, and more.

Make Your House a Home: Customize your character and build the home of your dreams! With hundreds of craftable items and customizable options, you can decorate your plot to make your home uniquely yours.

Play solo or jump in with friends at any time! Palia is a friendly, cozy community that's always here to welcome you home. Discover a shared world full of players and new friends and enjoy your adventure together.

item.title: What to Expect From Deltarune Chapter 5
item.description:
Massive spoilers for Deltarune Chapters 3 and 4 below.

Deltarune has made a comeback at one of the best times possible. 2025 marks the 10th anniversary of Undertale , and Deltarune is now a full-fledged experience available for purchase in time for the celebration. It might be the best present fans can ask for as Deltarune serves as Undertale 's parallel story, allowing players to meet up and interact with famous characters like Asgore, Sans, and most unexpectedly, Gerson.

Chapters 3 and 4 had their fair share of reveals and plot twists that set a lot of expectations for the next three chapters. The heroes of the prophecy have had a brutal realization that their story isn't always going to be about playing cards and acid-drinking queens. With a future tragedy looming over Kris, Ralsei, and Susie's heads, Chapter 4 ends with one of the most exciting reveals of all: Deltarune Chapter 5 is set to release in 2026. Now that the halfway point has been reached, though, foreshadowing seems to put Chapter 5 in an interesting position.

Deltarune Chapter 5 Will Most Likely Reignite an Old Conflict

How Deltarune Chapter 4 Let Fans in On Some Chapter 5 Secrets

In the Dark Sanctuary's study, players meet the character of "Old Man" who is described to be a Darkner made in the image of the late Gerson. If fans take a detour through the Sanctuary, Susie gets to fight the Old Man as a secret boss. During the fight between Susie and Old Man Gerson, he talks to her about the stories Lightner Gerson wrote based on the Delta Rune prophecy.

While these exchanges certainly take some liberties - Gerson's stories were only based on the prophecy after all - some fans likely had to look twice when Gerson began talking about the fifth book. According to his description, Chapter 5 will feature a garden that's burned down due to someone's jealousy. After the ending of Chapter 4, it's clear that the jealous culprit is none other than Asgore, as his ex-wife Toriel spent the night dancing with Sans in a way that made her more-than-friendly feelings for the skeleton rather obvious.

Asgore has spent most of his time in this game trying to woo the goat mom he still loves, but a secret in Deltarune Chapter 4 reveals he's focused on showing Toriel "what really happened" about an incident surrounding them. It also reveals that the fallen father is in possession of a Black Shard, an item that the player only gets by defeating the Roaring Knight.

Asgore also appears in the prophecy in the Dark Sanctuary. One piece depicts him as "the flower man, trapped in asylum." In the game's code, this illustration is stated to be depicting a boss. It might be a red herring, but it helps solidify Asgore's importance to Chapter 5.

Deltarune's Fifth Chapter Might be Just as Important as Chapter 4

Due to how Deltarune chapters play out over the course of a day, Chapter 5 will also feature an event players have been hearing about since Chapter 2. This is the Festival, the day when the entire town "becomes a carnival," according to Susie. There's a chance that the Festival might lead to a break in Deltarune 's usual structure, just like how Chapter 4 technically featured three dark worlds and a lengthy light world segment.

Gerson's foreshadowing only goes as far as to mention Chapter 5's book adaptation as well, and he only mentions there being one more story before the story "swallows" the author whole. There's a chance that Chapter 6 marks the end of the prophecy as fans know it, with Chapter 7 marking their chance to change it. There are only so many chapters left in Deltarune now, which means it won't be much longer until fans learn what the final tragedy is and find out if they can truly prevent it.

Deltarune is an incredibly hard game to predict. Chapters 3 and 4 debunked many Deltarune fan theories worth years of speculation. While players may have a bigger idea as to what's going on, Deltarune is still keeping a number of tricks up its sleeve, and Toby Fox still insists the game only has one ending. As mentioned before, what's known about Chapter 5 so far could be a red herring, but only by so much. It sounds like the next dark world players will visit will be the "field of pink and gold," one way or another, and fans can expect all of Deltarune 's trademark secrets and surprises along the way.

• Creative bullet-dodging based battles inspired by games like Touhou and Chrono Trigger.

• Jevilishly difficult hidden bosses.

• And...

• ...

• ... only 1 ending...?

item.title: Undisputed Confirms Free Content Update Coming This Week
item.description:
Steel City Interactive has officially unveiled a free content update for Undisputed , and it's coming to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC via Steam later this week. The latest Undisputed update, which will bring the game to version 1.4, will not only include a host of gameplay adjustments, bug fixes, and quality-of-life improvements but will also see three new fighters added to the game along with some other new features for players to check out.

After releasing four new patches in five weeks, Steel City Interactive went silent while it developed the upcoming new content update. After leaving fans in the dark for almost two months, the studio began unveiling some new details on what to expect from update 1.4 earlier this month. According to some early patch notes that were released by the game's community manager, the next Undisputed update will add a highly requested multi queue feature that should make online matchmaking much quicker. The new feature will allow players to select fighters from multiple weight divisions when searching for an online match, thus reducing the time it takes to get into the ring.

Undisputed Update 1.4 Coming June 26

After teasing the next Undisputed update multiple times this month, Steel City Interactive has now confirmed that patch 1.4 will be released for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC via Steam on Thursday, June 26. Patch notes aren't currently available, but a short video from the game's community manager has given fans a look at all of the new features and content coming with the update. The first addition will be robes for marquee fighters, such as Terence Crawford, Amir Khan, and more. There will also be some big improvements to the game's lighting and visuals on Xbox Series X and PC (specifically on Ultra settings). But undoubtedly the biggest piece of content in the update is the debut of three new fighters: Damian Chambers, Jack Dempsey, and Jack Johnson.

Fans can also expect a fresh batch of gameplay improvements and bug fixes in the next Undisputed update, as Steel City says it has also capped the get-up mini game success rate for AI, meaning players should find it much easier to keep their opponent down when playing offline modes. There are also some fighter improvements too, as the studio has updated the animations for Vasyl Lomachenko in order to make his character model more lifelike. Details on all of the bug fixes included in update 1.4 will be revealed with the patch notes tomorrow.

Steel City will also be releasing another Undisputed DLC fighter pack alongside tomorrow's update, but which fighters will be included in the DLC are currently unknown. In the past, Steel City has added some of the sports' most iconic boxers via new DLC packs, including Shannon Briggs, the Klitschko brothers, Dmitry Bivol, Julio Cesar Chavez, and many more.

item.title: Dead by Daylight Could Work Wonders With 28 Years Later’s Scariest Threat
item.description:
Spoilers ahead for 28 Years Later .

Dead by Daylight has a way of making players feel isolated and afraid through the way it portrays its Killers and Survivors. The multiplayer horror game gives players the opportunity to control either role as they navigate through dark and eerie maps. Dead by Daylight is also known for doing crossovers with various horror franchises to bring iconic characters to the game, adding new levels of fear to each match.

One of the most recent horror movies that's been making waves is 28 Years Later , the much-awaited third film in the 28 Days Later series. Similar to the last two movies, where the rage virus has taken over entire cities and countries, 28 Years Later explores an isolated British island where quarantined citizens exist and survive amid the ongoing infection on the mainland. Naturally, many of the infected zombies have also evolved throughout the years, which results in a terrifying new threat called the Alpha. If Dead by Daylight were to ever explore a crossover with 28 Years Later , now is the perfect opportunity to do so, with a sequel to 28 Years coming next year and another movie planned if it does well.

How 28 Years Later's Alpha Zombie Could Fit As a Dead by Daylight Killer

In Dead by Daylight , Killers are essentially sent by The Entity from different realms to hunt down and sacrifice every Survivor that comes into their paths. These Killers come in various forms and have unique abilities that allow them to terrorize their prey. This is why Dead by Daylight 's crossovers work so well; the game gives fans the chance to play as and against numerous horror icons, like Nightmare on Elm Street 's Freddy Krueger (The Nightmare) and even Five Nights at Freddy's Springtrap (The Animatronic).

Recently, 28 Years Later actor Alfie Williams, who plays Spike in the film, said in an interview with 1883 Magazine that he loves playing video games like Red Dead Redemption 2 and Dead by Daylight during his free time. In another interview, he specifically shared that he loves playing the Killer in Dead by Daylight , and enjoys trying out new characters. The game is quite fitting for someone whose breakout role is a movie about survival and working together in order to survive a world overridden with rage virus zombies. It especially strikes a chord seeing how Spike, with the help of Dr. Ian Kelson (played by Ralph Fiennes), uses his wits to ward off the Alpha that's chasing them on the mainland. So, it would be equally interesting to see a world where Williams gets to play as an Alpha in a possible Dead by Daylight x 28 Years Later crossover.

28 Years Later 's Alpha zombies are the biggest and strongest of their kind, often portrayed as a towering figure that can rip off a person or animal's head and parts of their spine clean. Every time the Alpha appears on-screen, it gives a sense of dread and hopelessness because it can kill people in an instant once he catches them. Although there are still many questions about Alphas in 28 Years Later 's world, they have definitely become one of the most memorable parts of the film. If the Alpha was a Dead by Daylight Killer, his kill animation could be a gory shot of the Survivor getting their head and spine ripped out of their body. He could also have the special ability briefly running superfast to close the distance between himself and Survivors, with the creature's loud footsteps sure to instill the same fear as his movie counterpart.

Design-wise, Dead by Daylight could retain the Alpha's imposing figure while also making sure he's not fully nude in the game.

At the same time, Survivors could be given access to morphine darts, the same ones that Dr. Kelson uses to temporarily sedate Alphas, so they could have time to start up the generators. Hiding in underground bunkers just like Spike and Dr. Kelson could also be advantageous to Survivors, especially if Dead by Daylight releases a map inspired by the mainland in 28 Years Later , which could even include the Bone Temple that Dr. Kelson built.

Granted, there are many other horror franchises that could get a spot on Dead by Daylight 's crossover radar. But considering 28 Years Later 's record-breaking success and the fans' anticipation of its sequel, The Bone Temple , this would be the perfect time for developer Behaviour Interactive to jump at the opportunity to turn the Alpha into a playable Killer. Unless, of course, The Bone Temple introduces another zombie form that's more sinister than the Alpha and an even better fit for Dead by Daylight .
